: Симферополь) is the capital city of the
All roads coming to Crimea lead to Simferopol, the undisputed transport hub of the region.

value: ) operates only flights to Russia with Russian airlines at the moment e.g.
, as the ICAO & Eurocontrol recommend to avoid the airspace. Main reason is that Ukranian & Russian air traffic controller claim to be responsible for the area. This duality could like to mistakes.

Marshrutka buses leave from across the car park outside the arrival area, look for the large
sign. Buses leave for city centre and the railway station every few minutes. Bus №49 connects with Central Intercity Bus Station, №115 or №98 with the railway station and the
bus station which have connections to sea-side cities such as

. Also, there are lots of annoying private taxi drivers at the airport, if you take a taxi always agree on a rate before you board a cab and make sure that the price is for the entire route (not for each kilometer).
Simferopol has very good train connections with all major domestic destinations and several international routes too. There are several daily trains from
(12 h) also have daily connections. International connections are mostly with
, there are daily overnight connections with
(38 h). There is also a daily night train service from
(68 h) in the Ural. Direct trains from central Europe have now disappeared with the twice-weekly night train from

being withdrawn in September 2011.

Domestic trains are handled by
while international connections with Russia are handled by
. Notice that domestic trains not always carry a restaurant wagon, be sure to supply yourself with food and drink.
There are about a dozen a day bus and

each day. They get busy, particularly at weekends, and it is best to book some time in advance. If you are unable to take public transport, taxis will take you there; from Sevastopol station to Simferopol airport, do not accept a fare of more than 300 UAH.

There is a
A convenient way to get around is by public transport, and Simferopol has a wide range of it! The most popular is called

or a minivan, minibus, or taxi. Taxi of course is most expensive but is a fastest alternative. A ride on the minivan or the bus however, will cost you only 2.75 griven (UAH). (US$1=8 UAH, €1=11 UAH). The public transportation will bring you almost all around the city.

Taxi - always agree on a rate before you board a cab. If driver offers you a cheap price make sure that this price is for the entire route not for each kilometer. Be warned that it's difficult to communicate with drivers, as they speak virtually no English or any other foreign language.

Taxi cost of 1 journey to any place of the city can be between 30 to 50 gr. To order taxi by phone is a way to save money. Some numbers: +380 (63) 250-3350, +380 (652) 547200, +380 (652) 710071 from mobile phone or 1504, 1567, 1568 and some others from local phone.
It's not the most interesting city, but there are a few things to see.

value: - the only square in Simferopol which boasts about nothing much. Skateboarders skating in the evenings, live concerts on and off, a place where locals usher in the New Year, a politician party campaigning site.
(Centralny Rynok) - everything from fresh food to clothes to hardware is easily available here. Generally the best place for shopping, and for getting
- a lovely building, especially to leave the city from.

content=Scythian Neapolis was a settlement that existed from the end of the 3rd century BC until the second half of the 3rd century AD. The archeological ruins sit on the outskirts of the present-day Simferopol. This city was the center of the Crimean Scythian tribes, led by Skilurus and Palacus (who were probably buried at the local mausoleum). The town ruled over a small kingdom, covering the lands between the lower Dnieper river and Crimea. In the 3rd and 2nd centuries BC, it was a city "with a mixed Scythian-Greek population, strong defensive walls and large public buildings constructed using the orders of Greek architecture". Neapolis was destroyed halfway through the 3rd century AD by the Goths.
File:Колесо обозрения в Детском Парке г. Симферополя..jpg
content=A wonderful place where you can relax with the whole family. There is small amusement park with Ferris wheel. Here you can buy cotton candy, popcorn and soda.
content=600 - 750 years old. Circumference of his tree trunk about 6 meters, diameter of the crown 30 meters. There are some smaller 300-500-year-old oaks nearby.
price=120 rub, kids - 20 rub. It's possible to buy cups of grain to feed the animals at the entrance

content=Although it's not up the Western standards it's still fun place to entertain both children and adults. There are more than 300 species of animal: camels, deer, bears, wolves, jaguars, leopards, monkeys, bison and some others.
content=Small aquarium where live about 10 species of turtles, 3-4 species of snakes, amphibians, fish and a few crocodiles.

content=It consists of two exhibitions: first is an exhibition of local art (paintings, drawings, sculptures, some photos from the museum of Aachen), second one is on the different subjects which changes every month.

There is always a time where you can run out of things to do in this place. Nevertheless if you look hard enough, you will find something to occupy your time with.

In the harsh hot weather during the summer with temperate ranging over 40-45 degree Celsius, you may take a stroll in the park. There are horse riding activities, boating, feeding ducks. Besides that, the best thing to do is rehydrate yourself as often as possible, and protect yourself with some SPF (read SPF 30 and above).

Then comes the other extreme - the cold chilly winter. Temperature may dip down to as low as -25 degree Celsius in late January and February. Skiing in Ai Petri is a great getaway from the town. In the centre itself, there is a skating rink. 
Besides that, you may opt to drink some vodka to keep yourself warm.

value: - located around 17km from the city. Take a minibus from the railway station to the end stop Perevalnoe for 3h, and then either walk 3km to the Red Cave or take a taxi 11km up a nearby mountain to the tremendous Marble Cave, discovered in 1987. A full tour takes 80 minutes and costs 70hr. Shorter tours are cheaper but the full one is well worth it.

The most popular place for shopping is in 'Silpo'. Its quite a big supermarket with all essential items and food stuff. There are also several boutiques in it. 

There are also supermarkets like 'Furshet' and 'Rainford' located around the city. Best would be to ask a taxi driver to take you to these places, or get familiarised with the names of the roads, and you can easily take a minivan there.

Minivan No. 62, 10 and 74 can take you to the newly built shopping place called "Foxmart".

Debit and credit cards are accepted in most shops in the city, but not accepted in rural area and markets. There are a lot of ATM.
The number one must eat food in Simferopol is the

. It's a local version of the Indian Biryani or the Spanish Paella. This rice dish is oily, so those with a heart problem may want to abstain from it. One plate of plov cost 7 UAH, approx €1 at the Central Market.

Number two must eat food is meat on skewer, cooked over charcoal. It's called
by the locals. Goes very well with raw onion with vinegar and with

( round bread). 

Number three on the list is

. A local version of Noodle soup. 

In fourth place is the local's favourite
. It's a vegetable soup, generally ate with bread.
, is also a local soup that is worth trying.
Crimean wine, best to buy in supermarkets or in a company outlet shops. Also drink Ukrainian vodka -

value: As with the rest of Crimea it's possible to find private accommodation, just look for people (mainly women) with signs "Housing" (Russian: Жильё) near the railway station. It's considerably cheaper than hotels, but it's of the very different quality. Ask for photos if available. The main gathering point for them is 100 meters away from the outdoor screen (displaying train temetables) in the direction to city center.
name=Hotel of the International children center "Artek"
directions=across the road from the railway station
price=850 rubles double room, 120 rubles dorm bed
content=Accommodating staff. Perfect furniture, hot water 24 hrs. Rooms are spacious. Breakfast - Ukrainian cuisine, fine.
content=Good budget hotel, built in 2012. Rooms with kitchenette. Beautiful grounds, ambient atmosphere.
content=Quite OK hotel. Friendly staff, breakfast is included in the room rate. Sauna with a pool. Cons: small rooms, poor Wi-Fi signal.
content=Pros: good location close to Central bus station, cafe available on the 8th floor. However, not so much friendly staff, rooms are not tide and looks old. Soviet style building.
content=30+ apartments in the Central area from budget to luxury. WiFi. Free pickup at the airport. For short and long term.
name=Guest house on the Suvorovsky descent
content=Good location: close to the center, as well as many restaurants, shops, banks. Clean and comfortable. Good free wi-fi. Bad soundproofing.

content=Decent hotel, Soviet-style, renovated in 2010. Convenient location, friendly staff, clean. Great selection of food for breakfast. Poor soundproofing. Some rooms have old furniture and bad WiFi.
directions=from the railway station by trolleybus 6, or by bus to the bus stop "Hotel Tavriya"
content=Old building, but after recent renovation. Spacious rooms. Not that quite conveniently located.
directions=located in the one of the most quiet Central parts of the city, surrounded by green trees and two parks
content=Small, cosy hotel. Good rooms and tasty breakfast.
directions=800 m from the Kuibyshev square
content=Very decent hotel. Conveniently located, friendly staff, good value for the money.
content=Bad combination of price and quality. Old furniture, cigarette's smell.
directions=centrally located in Stalin's well renovated building. Bus stop "Hotel Ukraine"

content=Probably the best 4 star hotel in the city. Recently renovated. Interior decoration reminds a palace. The hotel is not without flaws, sometimes unfriendly staff. Lovely Breakfast. Restaurant with good although expensive food, huge menu.
directions=on the airport - Simferopol highway (3km from the airport). Trolleybus 2/9; marshrutkas 40, 98, 100, 115
content=Clean, comfortable. Good breakfast included. Pleasant staff. Price - quality ratio is quite good.
directions=bus stop "Tavrida national University". Marshrutkas #64, #65 and trolleybus #6 from train station; marshrutka #49 from airport
content=Cosy budget private mini hotel. Although rooms have everything you need, but they are very small for the long term stay. Delicious food at the restaurant on ground floor.
content=Friendly and welcoming hosts. High-speed Internet, sauna and pool. Large and comfortable rooms, each room includes refrigerator and a stove.
